lines.line: How is the adventuring going, my friend?
Do you have any other quests for me? That last one of yours was so much fun, I was hoping you would!
Ooooh dear, I might have, but it's all very embarrassing...
Embarrassing? How do you mean?
Weeellll... You know I told you that it was the Duke's birthday?
Yup, that's why I had to go and collect you things to make a cake with wasn't it?
Yeeeesssss... Weeeelllll...
It isn't. I don't even know when his birthday is!
GRRRR! Why did you have me running around finding ingredients for you then?!?!
So you lied to me to get me to do you a favour?
Fair enough, you're not the first, but why lie? You could have just asked me, I'd have been happy to help.
I needed to test you and see if I could trust you...
I am in a terrible pickle, and I desperately need somebody trustworthy to help me out!
You need help AGAIN? Well, what seems to be the problem?
Well, you're obviously trustworthy, I guess I could tell you...
Please do. The suffering of others always seems to turn out very profitable for me.
Well... It's like this...
Did you ever hear of Franizzard Van Lumbcook?
Erm... Can't say I have.
And with a name like that, I'm sure I would remember.
Well, he was a great chef, and also my ancestor.

One hundred years ago there was a very important meeting held here in Lumbridge Castle, and he cooked a banquet for the meeting, which was so stupendously amazing that he was offered a job for life, along with all
of his descendants.
So you have your job because a hundred years ago your ancestor was a very good cook.
I don't see how that's much of a problem for you...
In fact I would say you are a VERY LUCKY man indeed. Frankly, I'd have fired you by now if you worked for me.
Oooooh no.... You don't understand...
This big important secret meeting that Franizzard cooked for is held here in Lumbridge castle every 10 years, and tonight will be the tenth anniversary of it!
Still not seeing the problem...
Well, I have always felt like a failure as a cook, and that my job here is down to the skills of my ancestor.
I want to prove to the world that I am a great cook too!
But to do that... (sigh) No, it just won't work...
What won't? Come on man, pull yourself together and speak to me!
(sniff) Weeeeelll... I thought that I would recreate the meal Franizzard cooked all of those years ago, the one that impressed
everybody so much... There's just this small problem though...
Let me take a wild guess: You have the recipe but you don't have any of the ingredients, and OBVIOUSLY you can't just go and get them yourself?
Yes! However did you know?
Call it a hunch.
Okay, tell me what you're after and then I'll decide if I want to help you or not.
Well, they are common enough ingredients, although I must admit the recipe I am following is very strange indeed...
I will pay you upfront for any expenses you may incur while obtaining them, and of course you may keep the change for being so helpful to me.
Please can you help me? The feast is scheduled to start very soon, and I simply cannot leave!
I would love to help you! What do I have to do?
Well, I have an incredibly important banquet that I have to prepare for, and I am using an ancient cookbook to recreate the meal my famous ancestor made a hundred years ago.
Most of the ingredients I was able to obtain fairly easily, but there were some... oddities... that I have been unable to lay my hands on.
Like what?
I need the following ingredients as soon as possible!
One Eye Of Newt A freshly made 'Dirty Blast' A rotten tomato
And a glass of greenman's ale.
I have given you 100 coins to cover any expenses you may incur, feel free to keep the change.
I'll go look for those for you then!
Welcome, gentlemen, to Lumbridge Castle.
I welcome Osman, Spymaster for the Emir of Al Kharid.
I thank you for your hospitality.
I welcome Selim, acting Spymaster for the Emir of Al Kharid.
I thank you for your hospitality.
I welcome the chief guard of the White Wolf Mountain dwarves.
The beer's good!
I welcome Pirate Pete from Braindeath Island.
Your rum's got no flavour!
I welcome the chief of the Goblin Village.
That me! Give me chair!
No, it me! Chair mine!
I welcome Skrach Uglogwee of the Feldip Hills ogres.
Der ogres, dey call me Bone Cruncher.
I welcome my neighbour, Phileas the Lumbridge Guide.
I didn't have far to travel!
From the town of Edgeville, I welcome Evil Dave.
These secret meetings are SOOO EVIL!
A hearty welcome to Sir Amik Varze, leader of the White Knights...
Do get a move on!
Aha! I'm BACK!
Did we invite you?
Hah! Your chef did! And now I'll kill you!
Sorry I'm late...
I remember you...
Aaargh!
Muahahaha!
TEMPUS CESSIT!
, you must help me defeat this evil!
Hi.
Hello there adventurer. How can I assist you?
Who are you?
I am the fortune-teller. My friends call me Aris.
Certainly. That fellow over there in the chef's hat is called the Culinaromancer.
A hundred years ago, he threatened the secret council with death, but was foiled by the quick thinking of his assistant, who managed to trap him in another dimension.

Now, apparently the current head cook of Lumbridge decided to recreate his ancestors greatest achievement, not realising that his achievement was not a meal but a powerful food-magic, and by recreating the spell he has
inadvertently freed the evil Culinaromancer from his prison, to wreak havoc upon this world once more.

Naturally, when I saw what was happening, I intervened with a simple Tempus Cessit spell, so that we would have time to immunise the secret council from his attack, and so that we can defeat the Culinaromancer
once and for all.
Each council member will have their own unique dish that will serve to counteract the Culinaromancer's spell.
Inspect the one you wish to save, and I will offer any advice I have.
Now you've freed them all, I'll restart time so you can deal with the culinaromancer.
If you're sure...
TEMPUS PROCEDIT!
What was that?
We have broken your feeble spell! Begone!
You DARED to meddle?
But you cannot defeat me! I'LL BE BACK!
Hooray - he's gone!
One day he'll return. You must go through the portal and finish him off.
You DARE come HERE?!?!
NOOOooo...
You will regret following me!
You should not meddle in affairs that do not concern you!
This will be your death!
I still have a few tricks left!
You have caused me enough grief! I guess I'll have to finish you off myself!
Good work ! I think that will be the last we'll see of him! You'd better come back now.

characters.name: Aris
characters.description: Elderly female, British accent, mysterious and wise tone. A powerful fortune-teller with vast magical knowledge and an inhuman lifespan, calm under pressure but firm when needed.

characters.name: Cook
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, nervous and apologetic tone. The head cook of Lumbridge Castle who lacks confidence in his abilities, often flustered and prone to needing help.

characters.name: Culinaromancer
characters.description: Adult male, dramatic British accent, sinister and theatrical tone. An evil food mage with a flair for villainous monologues, menacing yet somewhat pompous.

characters.name: Duke Horacio
characters.description: Middle-aged male, refined British accent, formal and dignified tone. The noble ruler of Lumbridge, composed and ceremonial in his speech.

characters.name: Evil Dave
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, overly dramatic and enthusiastic tone. An aspiring dark wizard who lives in his mother's basement, tries too hard to be evil but is mostly harmless.

characters.name: General Bentnoze
characters.description: Adult male, gruff and simple-minded tone with broken grammar. A goblin general who favors red armor, argumentative and dim-witted.

characters.name: General Wartface
characters.description: Adult male, gruff and simple-minded tone with broken grammar. A goblin general who favors green armor, constantly bickering with Bentnoze over trivial matters.

characters.name: Lumbridge Guide
characters.description: Middle-aged male, friendly British accent, helpful and cheerful tone. A knowledgeable guide who assists newcomers to the area with patience and warmth.

characters.name: Mountain Dwarf
characters.description: Adult male, gruff Scottish-like accent, blunt and beer-loving tone. A hardy dwarf guard from White Wolf Mountain who speaks plainly and appreciates good ale.

characters.name: Osman
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Middle Eastern accent, calculating and secretive tone. The cunning spymaster of Al Kharid, professional and measured in his words.

characters.name: Pirate Pete
characters.description: Adult male, rough pirate accent, boisterous and critical tone. A seafaring pirate from Braindeath Island with strong opinions about rum quality.

characters.name: Selim
characters.description: Adult male, Middle Eastern accent, formal and professional tone. An agent working under Osman, respectful and diplomatic.

characters.name: Sir Amik Varze
characters.description: Middle-aged male, refined British accent, impatient and authoritative tone. The leader of the White Knights and regent of Asgarnia, noble but often curt.

characters.name: Skrach Uglogwee
characters.description: Adult male, deep and slow voice with broken grammar. An ogre chieftain known as Bone Cruncher, intimidating but straightforward.
